00081   struct MatchedPair
00082   {
00083     int first;
00084     int second;
00085     double distance;
00086     bool operator<(const MatchedPair& o) const 
00087     { return this->distance < o.distance; }
00088   };
00089 
00090   // Simple struct to collect together standard attributes
00091 
00092   // Note: Unlike a class, all attributes of a struct are public
00094   struct PtThing
00095   {
00096     PtThing() {}
00097     ~PtThing() {}
00098 
00100     PtThing(const PtThing& rhs)
00101     {
00102       *this = rhs; // this will call assignment operator
00103     }
00104 
00106     PtThing& operator=(const PtThing& rhs)
00107     {
00108       index  = rhs.index;
00109       id     = rhs.id;
00110       type   = rhs.type;
00111       pt  = rhs.pt;
00112       eta = rhs.eta;
00113       phi = rhs.phi;
00114       et  = rhs.et;
00115       charge = rhs.charge;
00116       var = rhs.var;
00117       return *this;
00118     }
00119 
00123     float deltaR(PtThing& thing)
00124     {
00125       float deta = eta - thing.eta;
00126       float dphi = phi - thing.phi;
00127     
00128       // Make sure acute
00129       if ( fabs(dphi) > TMath::Pi() ) dphi = TMath::TwoPi() - fabs(dphi);
00130       return sqrt(deta*deta+dphi*dphi);
00131     }
00132 
00134     bool matches(PtThing& thing, float drcut=0.4)
00135     {
00136       return deltaR(thing) < drcut;
00137     }
00138 
00139     int index;
00140     int id;
00141     std::string type;
00142     float pt;
00143     float eta;
00144     float phi;
00145     float et;
00146     float charge;
00147     
00149     std::map<std::string, float> var;
00150     
00152     bool operator<(const PtThing& o) const { return o.pt < this->pt; }
00153   };
00154   
00175   class Count
00176   {
00177   public:
00179     Count() : _var(std::map<std::string, int>()) {}
00180 
00182     ~Count(){}
00183 
00185     int operator()(std::string var) 
00186     {
00187       if ( _var.find(var) == _var.end() ) _var[var] = 0;
00188       _var[var]++;
00189       return _var[var];
00190     }
00191     
00193     void ls(std::ostream& os = std::cout)
00194     {
00195       int index = 0;
00196       for(std::map<std::string, int>::iterator 
00197             it = _var.begin(); it != _var.end(); it++)
00198         {
00199           index++;
00200           std::string var = it->first + 
00201             "   .......................................................";
00202           int count  = it->second;
00203           var = var.substr(0,40);
00204           char record[80];
00205           sprintf(record,"%5d %-40s %10d", index, var.c_str(), count);
00206           os << record << std::endl;
00207         }
00208     }
00209     
00210   private:
00211     std::map<std::string, int> _var;
00212   };

00227   template <typename X>
00228   struct Value : public ValueThing
00229   {
00230     Value(X& x) : x_(x) {}
00231     ~Value() {}
00232 
00233     std::string str() 
00234     {
00235       std::ostringstream os;
00236       os << x_;
00237       return os.str();
00238     }
00239     void* address() { return static_cast<void*>( &x_ ); }
00240 
00241     X x_;
00242   };

00629   // Statistics
00630 
00632   // File:    poissongamma.hpp
00633   // Description:       x = poissongamma(p,a,d[,returnlog,[scale]])
00634   // 
00635   //              compute the marginal likelihood:
00636   //              a product of Poisson distributions
00637   //              and a prior that is a product of gamma distributions.
00638   //
00639   //              Model:
00640   //
00641   //              d_i = Sum p_j * a_ji,  i=1..M,   j=1..N
00642   // 
00643   //              D_i  is count corresponding to true mean d_i
00644   //              A_ji is count corresponding to true mean a_ji
00645   //
00646   //              D is a vector of M observed counts (that is, over M bins)
00647   //              p is a vector of N parameters (that is, over N sources)
00648   //              A is a vector of vectors of size N x M counts.
00649   //
00650   // WARNING: The number of terms grows exponentially with the number of 
00651   //          sources and the maximum bin count. Therefore, this routine
00652   //          really only makes sense for rather few sources with modest
00653   //          bin counts. When the number of sources is > 4 and/or the 
00654   //          maximum observed bin count is large use poissongammamc,
00655   //          which does the calculation by Monte Carlo integration.
00656   //
00657   // Created: 20-Dec-2001 Harrison B. Prosper
00658   //          11-Mar-2004 HBP change typedefs
00659   //          21-Jun-2005 HBP add poissongammasmc
00661 
00662   
00664   static
00665   double logpoisson(vdouble&    p,  // Weights "p_j" 
00666                     vvdouble&   A,  // Counts  "A_ji" for up to 10 sources
00667                     vdouble&    D,  // Counts  "D_i" for data.
00668                     bool scale=true); // Scale p_j if true  
00669 
00671   static
00672   double poissongamma(vdouble&  p,        // Weights "p_j" 
00673                       vvdouble& A,        // Counts "A_ji" for up to 10 sources
00674                       vdouble&  D,        // Counts  "D_i" for data.
00675                       bool returnlog=false, // return log(P) if true
00676                       bool scale=true);     // Scale p_j if true  
00677   
00679   static
00680   double poissongamma1D(double xsec,
00681                         double Lum,
00682                         double sigmaLum,
00683                         double B,
00684                         double sigmaB,
00685                         double Datum);
00686   
00687 
00689   static
00690   double poissongamma2(double     p1,
00691                        double     p2,
00692                        vdouble&   A1,
00693                        vdouble&   A2,
00694                        vdouble& D,
00695                        bool returnlog=false,
00696                        bool scale=true);
00697

00700   double poissongamma5(double   p1,
00701                        double     p2,
00702                        double     p3,
00703                        double     p4,
00704                        double     p5,
00705                        vdouble&   A1,
00706                        vdouble&   A2,

00717                           int total=10000);  // Number of MC sampling points
